name: residential
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 A residential road, area, etc. has only private houses, not offices and factories. Compare
non-residential
A residential building is one in which people live: Behind the beach are high-rise hotels and residential buildings. The architect's tallest building is a 75 storey residential tower. Compare
non-residential
C2 A residential job, position, course, etc. is one for which you live at the same place where you work or study: The college runs residential courses throughout the summer. Compare
non-residential
relating to where you live or have lived: You must satisfy the residential qualifications to get a work permit.
More examplesFewer examplesIt was not safe to locate the chemicals factory in a residential area.Rents in residential areas are lower than in the business district.The agency deals with residential and commercial property.The residential course for writers takes place in August.
